ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: French reading, speaking, writing, and listening skills
i learned a lot of french this semester despite having a background in it
The course introduced me to the French language and taught me the beginnings of a language I hope to continue to learn
I really learned how to speak, write and listen to french! The course is speedy but it made me feel confident about my basic french skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the course provided an immersive experience of learning French. After a semester, I learned a lot about the language and can hold very basic conversations in French

Weaknesses: some of the homework were not well-thought-out to facilitate learning (ex. the Defis); the tests were plenty and not well organized (part of the speaking and listening portion were messed up); heavy, heavy workload; textbook can be frustrating sometimes
The course is a great entry into the language and very challenging for someone with any other language experience. The textbook however functions more as a workbook and less as an instructional text

The instructor is great ! He really acres about the students and about our learning. The museum activity was amazing. 
I consider that one of the weakness of the course are the evaluations in the computer using lingo, we get tested in a very different environment thatn the classroom, with french speakers with different accents, that speak faster, and with counted time to complete a writign and speaking and listening section that does not give time for revisions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you love French or are going to a francophone country to study, work etc. Not for everyone because it consumes a lot of your time to stay afloat
yes, but make sure you keep up with the daily homework, it's very easy to fall behind.
Yes, this is a great entry into a language
Yes of course!! This is an amazing course for anyone looking to learn french and start developing their skills.
